Package uk.ac.rdg.resc.edal.graphics.utils

Class LegendDataGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.rdg.resc.edal.graphics.utils.LegendDataGenerator
  • public class LegendDataGenerator
extends Object
    A class to generate the correct data for a legend. This provides methods to get a set of PlottingDomainParams and a corresponding FeatureCatalogue. When these two objects are passed to a MapImage.drawImage(PlottingDomainParams, FeatureCatalogue) an appropriate map will be drawn with linearly-varying fields, suitable for use as a legend. The names of the fields to use are set in the LegendDataGenerator#getFeatureCatalogue(String, String) method
    Author:
    Guy Griffiths

    • Constructor Detail

      • LegendDataGenerator

        public LegendDataGenerator​(int width,
                           int height,
                           BufferedImage backgroundMask,
                           float fractionExtra)
        Instantiate a new LegendDataGenerator
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the domain (which will translate to the final image width in pixels)
        height - The height of the domain (which will translate to the final image height in pixels)
        backgroundMask - An image to use as a background mask - i.e. where the missing data should be generated. Pixels with value 0 (usually black) are interpreted as missing data
        fractionExtra - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in both directions (both above the max and below the min)

      • LegendDataGenerator

        public LegendDataGenerator​(int width,
                           int height,
                           BufferedImage backgroundMask,
                           float fractionExtraX,
                           float fractionExtraY)
        Instantiate a new LegendDataGenerator
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the domain (which will translate to the final image width in pixels)
        height - The height of the domain (which will translate to the final image height in pixels)
        backgroundMask - An image to use as a background mask - i.e. where the missing data should be generated. Pixels with value 0 (usually black) are interpreted as missing data
        fractionExtraX - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in the x-direction (both above the max and below the min)
        fractionExtraY - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in the y-direction (both above the max and below the min)

      • LegendDataGenerator

        public LegendDataGenerator​(int width,
                           int height,
                           BufferedImage backgroundMask,
                           float fractionExtraXLow,
                           float fractionExtraXHigh,
                           float fractionExtraYLow,
                           float fractionExtraYHigh)
        Instantiate a new LegendDataGenerator
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the domain (which will translate to the final image width in pixels)
        height - The height of the domain (which will translate to the final image height in pixels)
        backgroundMask - An image to use as a background mask - i.e. where the missing data should be generated. Pixels with value 0 (usually black) are interpreted as missing data
        fractionExtraXLow - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in the x-direction below the minimum
        fractionExtraXHigh - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in the x-direction above the maximum
        fractionExtraYLow - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in the y-direction below the minimum
        fractionExtraYHigh - The fraction of the total data which should be counted as out of range data in the y-direction above the maximum

    • Method Detail

      • getPlottingDomainParams

        public PlottingDomainParams getPlottingDomainParams()
        Returns:
        A set of PlottingDomainParams which correspond to the entire range and given of the domain of the data returned by LegendDataGenerator#getFeatureCatalogue(NameAndRange, NameAndRange)

      • getFeatureCatalogue

        public FeatureCatalogue getFeatureCatalogue​(Drawable.NameAndRange xField,
                                            Drawable.NameAndRange yField,
                                            Map<String,​Float> values)
        Gets a FeatureCatalogue to generate features with linearly-varying numerical data and the correct members
        Parameters:
        xField - A Drawable.NameAndRange object for the field which should vary linearly in the x-direction. Set to null for no x variation
        yField - A Drawable.NameAndRange object for the field which should vary linearly in the y-direction. Set to null for no y variation
        values - A Map of other field names to desired values. This will allow a particular field to generate non NaN values. For example, a direction fields should never return NaN, so this allows a predefined value to be used instead
        Returns:
        A FeatureCatalogue which when the FeatureCatalogue.getFeaturesForLayer(String, PlottingDomainParams) method is called will return a set of features containing both MapFeatures and PointFeatures suitable for plotting. Note that the PlottingDomainParams argument is ignored here, and the PlottingDomainParamss which should be used in the MapImage.drawImage(PlottingDomainParams, FeatureCatalogue) method are those returned by getPlottingDomainParams()

      • getMapFeature

        protected MapFeature getMapFeature​(Drawable.NameAndRange field,
                                   LegendDataGenerator.MatrixType type)
        Generates a MapFeature containing the correctly named variables
        Parameters:
        field - The variable to vary linearly
        type - The way to vary the variable - in the x-direction, the y-direction, or to only return NaNs
        Returns:
        A MapFeature containing the correctly named variable with the correct linearly-varying data

      • getMapFeature

        protected MapFeature getMapFeature​(Drawable.NameAndRange field,
                                   LegendDataGenerator.MatrixType type,
                                   Float fixed)
        Generates a MapFeature containing the correctly named variables
        Parameters:
        field - The variable to vary linearly
        type - The way to vary the variable - in the x-direction, the y-direction, or to only return NaNs
        fixed - The fixed value to return if type is LegendDataGenerator.MatrixType FIXED
        Returns:
        A MapFeature containing the correctly named variable with the correct linearly-varying data

      • getPointFeatures

        protected Collection<PointFeature> getPointFeatures​(Drawable.NameAndRange field,
                                                    LegendDataGenerator.MatrixType type)
        Generates PointFeatures spread across the given ranges
        Parameters:
        field - The variable to vary linearly
        type - The way to vary the variable - in the x-direction, the y-direction, or to only return NaNs
        Returns:
        A Collection of randomly-distributed (but consistent - i.e. not random...) PointFeatures whose values vary linearly over the given direction

      • getPointFeatures

        protected Collection<PointFeature> getPointFeatures​(Drawable.NameAndRange field,
                                                    LegendDataGenerator.MatrixType type,
                                                    Float fixed)
        Generates PointFeatures spread across the given ranges
        Parameters:
        field - The variable to vary linearly
        type - The way to vary the variable - in the x-direction, the y-direction, or to only return NaNs
        fixed - The fixed value to return if type is LegendDataGenerator.MatrixType FIXED
        Returns:
        A Collection of randomly-distributed (but consistent - i.e. not random...) PointFeatures whose values vary linearly over the given direction

        Extends a scale range by a specified amount
        Parameters:

        fractionExtraLow - The fraction to extend it by on the low end
        fractionExtraHigh - The fraction to extend it by on the high end
        Returns:

      • getLinearInterpolatedValue

        protected static Number getLinearInterpolatedValue​(int value,
                                                   Extent<Float> scaleRange,
                                                   int axisSize)
        Linearly interpolates a value based on its index along an axis
        Parameters:
        value - The index within the axis
        scaleRange - The scale range to interpolate onto
        axisSize - The size of the axis
        Returns:
        A value which represents the supplied index within the given scale range
